sn12.32:1.2: Kaḷāra the Aristocrat is otherwise unknown.
sn12.32:1.4: For Phagguna of the Top-Knot, see note on SN 12.12:2.1.
sn12.32:8.5: Read khīṇasmiṁ khīṇam’iti with PTS and BJT, paralleling the common phrase vimuttasmiṁ vimuttam’iti (SN 12.61:6.2). | The syntax here is convoluted: “With the end of that source which is the source of rebirth, I knew regarding that ending, ‘it is ended’.”
sn12.32:12.2: The Buddha focuses in on the topic of feelings. The commentary explains this with reference to the Dīghanakhasutta (MN 74), which relates the occasion Sāriputta realized arahantship. The main topic, and the basis for Sāriputta’s insight, was feelings. The Buddha wanted to give Sāriputta the chance to highlight his special domain.
sn12.32:14.9: Variants for nānussavanti are from the roots sav (“flow”) and sī (“lie”). Pali often couples verbs and nouns from the same root for emphasis, and this is probably the case here, “defilements don’t defile”.
sn12.32:16.2: Pubbe appaṭisaṁviditaṁ is an idiom elsewhere used when visiting someone “without letting them know beforehand” (MN 91:26.4, AN 5.50:4.7).
